Hi Mark,

I gave a lecture on the fittings and koshirae Saturday evening ar=
ound  
7:30. Sorry you missed it.

Gordon

On Sep 8, 2006, at 5:52 AM, Mark=
 Conneran wrote:

> For what it's worth, as a potential "new-bee", I though=
t I'd be  
> presumptuous
> enough to make a few observations regarding the=
 Jersey City show. I  
> came up
> to the show with a friend, hoping to tak=
e in a lecture or two.  
> Obviously a
> lot of work went into it. A few th=
oughts, for what it's worth, as
> constructive criticism. We went to the ta=
ikai and skipped the shinsa
> thinking that the latter would only be for th=
ose submitting swords  
> to be
> evaluated. The taikai was worthwhile for =
the budo demonstrations  
> alone. The
> swords in the sword display, howev=
er, were not labeled and we were, of
> course, curious to know what it was =
we were viewing.
>
> We are both members of JSS/US but haven't attended any=
 of the NY club
> meetings and really have little sword knowledge. As such =
I'm  
> enormously
> impressed by the knowledge of the members of this list=
. But from the
> comments I've seen here earlier discussing the need to att=
ract "new  
> blood",
> I think activities such as the "introduction to swo=
rd handling"  
> lecture
> might perhaps be expanded and publicized. Again,=
 for what it's worth.
>
> Mark Conneran
>
>

> It would be funny, if it were not so sad. This=
 list and a shinsa
> should be a serious opportunity for learning. I hope t=
hat people can
> learn from a shinsa. I also encourage everyone to ask ques=
tions.
> There were too few people who picked up their pieces and did not a=
sk
> for an explanation. Next time, if there is one for you, ask the guy
> =
taking your money to call me over. I will be happy, or not, to
> explain an=
ything you want to know. That is why we are doing a shinsa.
> Not to make y=
ou feel bad, but to try and share some knowledge with
> you. If I was hard =
on Ted, I am sorry. If Ted would like to contact
> me off line, I would be =
happy to help him understand his results. We
> are doing another shinsa in =
Chicago next April. Please use this
> opportunity to learn. Also, if anyone=
 would like to volunteer to help
> out along with Milt, let me know and you=
 can share in the process.
>
> Gordon
